There are a lot of other features like overcharge protection, support for HD audio (which should be enabled in the developer options manually).The display is excellent for this price and so is the battery. The default audio settings are not good and should be changed to balanced in the custom audio settings and also turn off surround sound. Once you do that you get excellent audio quality, I use a Spundmagic E11BT and the sound is excellent. The call quality is excellent and pretty loud and clear. The single speak does its job without any fuss. The personalisation options and moto gestures along with the stock android gives an amazing user experience. The only downside is the camera which nerds some work and can be improved with a software update. The default setting of the camera is 12MP,, to enable 108MP you have to enable high resolution in photo settings. This will result in every pic occupying 25-30MB of storage. If you are using a sd card just make sure it's a fast one. Overall very satisfied with the phone.

A decent enough phone with its pros and cons which is to be expected from any phone. But it didn't turn out to be as good as I had hoped it would.
Some compromise were expected, like the all plastic build and lack of sterio speakers. But because of few peculiar cons, this device failed to impress me.

Pros:
1) Clean UI/ Stock Android with some extra features that are actually useful.
2) Option for optimised charging.
3) Good enough performance for day to day usage.
4) Great display*
5) Not heavy.
6) Great battery backup + 30 W fast charging
7) 3.5 mm headphone jack

Cons:
1) Terrible camera sensor and even worse camera app. The camera is easily the worst thing about this phone. It is pretty much useless. The big number (108 MP) does not matter, the resulting images are just awful. I've tried a few 3rd party camera apps, but nothing worked properly. Unless Motorola fixes this with a software update (if it can even be fixed), the camera setup is just USELESS.
2) Streaming: Can't stream HD content on Prime. (Haven't checked on Netflix yet, will update it when I do) Even though this device has Widevine L1 certification, but can't stream HD content. Also, NO HDR capabilities.
The phone also does not stream 10bit content. No point in having a 10 bit full hd panel if you can't use it for multimedia. Unless you download 10bit content and view it with players like VLC Player, the 10 bit panel is of no use.
3) Bluetooth range is weak.
4) Average haptic feedback.
5) Unlocking via fingerprint sensor feels slow. A phone in 2021 with a physical fingerprint sensor should not be this slow. Weird animation choice, hope they fix this also in an update.
6) No gallery app. Google Photos isn't all that great.
7) Sound output could have been better. It is just average enough that it doesn't get frustrating.
8)Low Wifi Range: Not enough people are talking about it, but the wifi range is also really bad on this one. My Realme x2 pro has far superior wifi range than this. When I get 100% wifi coverage on my Realme X2 Pro, I barely get 40% on Moto Edge 20 Fusion.

Overall a good phone for the price only if you can ignore the above mentioned cons. (I can't emphasize enough how bad the cameras are). Motorola can fix most of the cons with a software update, and I'm hoping they do.

Got this in the month of January 2022 and I haven't been disappointed. I thought dividing the review into pros and cons might help people; here goes:
Pros:-

1) Software:
My biggest reason to go for this phone over other brands like Xiaomi/Samsung/Realme etc is the software experience. You get Stock Android which is clean, ad-free and has no bloatware. I have used phones with MIUI before and they were terrible. I see many people go for the specs of Xiaomi or other brands...please don't. In day-to-day tasks, more or less all midrange phones perform well. (For example, the difference between something like a SD 720G and 778G is VERY SMALL, unless you run benchmarks or play heavy games.)

2) Display:
This is not an AMOLED screen but an OLED one with 90hz, but the difference is hardly noticeable. This is an excellent and a big display, with good viewing angles and colour reproduction. Watching videos/shows/movies is enjoyable on this screen. I have not noticed any lag/stutter during my usage so far. (Thanks to the OS)

3)Battery and Charging:
The battery backup on this phone is OUTSTANDING. During my usage (I don't play any games), I got around 8-9 hours of screen-on time using 90hz with 25-30% battery left, the next morning. Even with heavy usage, it should last well over a day. For moderate/light users (like me) the battery lasts almost 1.5 to 2 days.

You get a 30W charge with the phone and it charges the phone fast enough. (25-30% to 100% in a bit more than an hour.)

4) Performance:
Day to day tasks are handled by the phone just fine and the RAM management is good. I went for the 6GB variant and I haven't noticed any lags or stutters.


Cons:
1) Camera:
The cameras of the phone is a hit and miss. It performed well in good lighting conditions but the performance deteriorated in low and artificial lightning. The main and macro camera are fine but the wide-angle one clicks soft pictures that aren't colour accurate. The selfie camera was bad but it got fixed after a recent update. (I would recommend using the Gcam app as it improves the camera by a mile.)

2) Connectivity:
I didn't think I would say this but this phone has some connectivity issues, with the Bluetooth and Wifi. It takes quite a lot of time to connect to my home Wifi or even any other network for that reason and even then, it shows "Limited Connection", unless I restart the phone or change the MAC address properties. The Bluetooth range seems short too, compared to my previous phone (Asus M1 Max Pro). This is probably a software bug which I hope they fix with an OTA update.

3) Google Photos:
The default gallery app of the phone is Google Photos (which is fine by me) but many might not use it. The app essentially backs up your photos to a cloud storage (your default Google storage of 15GB) and after you exhaust your first 15GB of storage, you will have to pay for extra storage. It is advisable that you download a third party gallery app to store your pictures and videos on your device.

4) The Google Assistant Button doesn't work half the time and it's a shame that it can't customised. It's an annoyance (but not a deal-breaker either).

We all know about the technical specs so don't wanna waste time to discuss the same. Let's get straight to the Pros and Cons.

CONS:

1. Camera is good only on paper. In reality it does not perform as 108MP. Pretty average cameras. GCam can sort out the issue though.
2. Bluetooth range is poor compared to other brands at even of lower prices. Audio quality via Bluetooth is also average.
3. Wifi range is also a bit low but does the job. Not a con for casual users.
4. Notification light is there but not optimized to work. Sometime it works at switch off condition. Pretty weird.
5. Peek Display is a great option to have but very irritating at the same time. Even if the table shakes a bit the display turns on. Instead double tap to wake or lock would have been much better.
6. No Always on Display.

PROS:

1. Call quality via earpiece is very good along with network reception and Wifi calling.
2. Display is also great but not as good as flagship devices. Pretty good at the price point.
3. Battery is too good. Gives easily for one and a half day with moderate usage (without gaming). Charging speed is okay, took approx 75 to 80 mins to charge from 10% to 100%.
4. UI is very good, no bugs, no bloatware, no ads. Its a charm to use such smooth UI. No more headache with software updates like others are pushing tons of bugs with updates.
5. Despite having a 6.67 inch display and 5000mAh battery, the phone is very light and comfortable to use. Only 185 grams. But not for single handed use.
6. 3.5mm jack is a blessing to have coz my Sennheiser, Sony and JBL headsets are far superior than the budget TWS.
7. Last but not the least, Finger print sensor is very responsive. Works 100% time.

I am not a gamer so cannot comment on gaming part. It is basically an all rounder phone for those who are mainly need a phone for day to day use. Nothing either extra ordinary nor a bad performer. Motorola is back with a bang but needs to improve more.

pros.MediaTek Dimensity 800U Processor: The 800U processor gives a good performance. No lags while playing games on this device.
pros.Sound: Fantastic sound quality with just a single speaker. Exceeds the expectations.

cons.Camera: The 108 MP rear camera is not upto the mark. There are focussing issues and a lot of processing time is taken for the image. 32 MP selfie camera is also a big dissapointment.
